column4: guys why swap partition is off, but when i turn it on when i restart my pc its still off. and tryed turning it on via live cd but it was already on...how cna i fix this?
is swap being mounted in your /etc/fstab ?
i dont know what that means by buy partition manager has nothign mounted or anything just the label "swap"
cat /etc/fstab  .. do you see swap anywhere in there?
yes but I think it ahs the wrong UUID i think, another thread to fix splahs said swap could be off which got me here and did a command but coming out with diff UUID
sudo blkid   .. that will give you the correct UUID
http://pastebin.com/m1cb89685
change the UUID in fstab to match the output of blkid
how?
unmount swap then run sudo mount -a   .. if all works you're done
gksudo gedit /etc/fstab
i went into partition editor and hit swap off is thta ok?
verify that it has been unmounted then yes.
how do I do that now? sorry im still learning
sudo swapoff -a .. but i think that looks at fstab for the ID..  partition editor should be fine.
thanks alot i hope this fixes it let me restrat pc brb man
wait!..
sudo mount -a will mount it if it worked.. no need to reboot
ya but it turns off when pc shuts off or reboots and i have to turn if off manulyl thats what i need to see
everytime i turn pc on, i have to turn it on
you get it working?
have not restarted pc but so far now, i have like 2 apps for chaging it but everytime i use one the settings dont stick during reboot, i got it to show up for 4 seconds then turns to text...its wierd
pastebin your /boot/grub/menu.lst
